Suicide Crisis Response Protocol

⚠️ IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:
1. Take all suicide statements seriously
2. Do not leave the person alone if at immediate risk
3. Remove or secure potential means of harm
4. Call emergency services (999 in Singapore) if imminent danger

Warning Signs of Immediate Risk:
• Talking about wanting to die or kill themselves
• Looking for ways to kill themselves
• Talking about feeling hopeless or having no purpose
• Extreme mood swings
• Increased substance use
• Acting anxious, agitated, or reckless
• Sleeping too little or too much
• Withdrawing or isolating
• Showing rage or seeking revenge

DO:
• Stay calm and listen
• Ask directly: "Are you thinking about suicide?"
• Show empathy and understanding
• Take them seriously
• Keep them safe
• Help them connect to professional help
• Follow up after the crisis

DON'T:
• Promise to keep it a secret
• Minimize their feelings ("It's not that bad")
• Argue or debate about suicide
• Leave them alone if in immediate danger
• Try to handle it alone - get help

Emergency Contacts:
• Emergency Services: 999
• Samaritans of Singapore (SOS): 1767 (24-hour)
• Institute of Mental Health: 6389 2222

After the Crisis:
1. Ensure they have professional follow-up
2. Remove means of harm from environment
3. Create a safety plan together
4. Involve trusted family/friends with permission
5. Schedule follow-up contact
6. Document the incident
